page.title: 16FARMING AROUND MIDHURST
page.content: All farms but 1 are tenanted from the Cowdray Estate.Most are 28O-3OO acres, mainly arable,worked with modern machinery and chemical aids.Farm buildings have not usually been modernised and many are over 1OO years old.Most farms have a dairy unit for a secondary income.Loves farm is typical of local farms.It is a 3OO acre unit and lets some rough grazing to a neighbour's beef stock.Water is drawn from the mains and the river which flows through the farm.A serious problem is erosion of the sandy soil. When it rains the soil is carried down through the village street about a mile away. The Water Authority has some local problems caused by cattle straying into the river and with pollution of the water when silage effluent is allowed to drain into the river.
